Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 0: Bryan College, a private (non-denominational) institution located in Dayton, Tennessee, was founded in 1930. The college has an enrollment of 1,044 students and joined the conference in 2001. They are nicknamed the Lions.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 1: Point University is a member institution in the Appalachian Athletic Conference, located in West Point, Georgia. It is a four-year, small, highly residential university known as Point University Skyhawks, with a library named Point University Library. The university, founded in 1937, joined the conference in 2011. It is a private institution affiliated with Christian churches and churches of Christ and has an enrollment of 1,000 students. The sports teams are nicknamed the Skyhawks.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 5: Reinhardt University, a private (Methodist) institution located in Waleska, Georgia, was founded in 1883. The university has an enrollment of 1,057 students and joined the conference in 2009. They are nicknamed the Eagles.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 6: St. Andrews University, a private institution located in Laurinburg, North Carolina, was founded in 1958. The university has an enrollment of 800 students and joined the conference in 2012. They are nicknamed the Knights.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 7: Savannah College of Art and Design at Atlanta, a private institution located in Atlanta, Georgia, was founded in 2005. The college has an enrollment of 2,000 students and joined the conference in 2012. They are nicknamed the Bees.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 8: Tennessee Wesleyan College, a private (Methodist) institution located in Athens, Tennessee, was founded in 1857. The college has an enrollment of 1,103 students and joined the conference in 2001. They are nicknamed the Bulldogs.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 9: Truett-McConnell College, a private/Christian (Baptist) institution located in Cleveland, Georgia, was founded in 1946. The college has an enrollment of 550 students and joined the conference in 2013. They are nicknamed the Bears.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 11: Virginia Intermont College, a private/Christian (Baptist) institution located in Bristol, Virginia, was founded in 1884. The college has an enrollment of 916 students and joined the conference in 2001. They are nicknamed the Cobras.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 2: Milligan College, also part of the Appalachian Athletic Conference, is situated in Elizabethton, Tennessee. Founded in 1866, it joined the conference in 2001. It is a private college associated with the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ) and has an enrollment of 1,006 students. The sports teams are known as the Milligan Buffaloes.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 3: Montreat College is another institution within the Appalachian Athletic Conference, located in Montreat, North Carolina. This private college, founded in 1916 and joined the conference in 2001, is affiliated with the Presbyterian Church. It has an enrollment of 1,145 students, and its sports teams are called the Montreat Cavaliers.
Appalachian Athletic ConferenceIndex 10: Union College, based in Barbourville, Kentucky, is a member of the Appalachian Athletic Conference. It was founded in 1879 and joined the conference in 2001. This private college is affiliated with the Methodist Church and has an enrollment of 1,368 students. The sports teams are known as the Union Bulldogs.
